text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Jessica a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dallas today I'm going to show you how
to implement Disaster Recovery or fault
tolerance for your Amazon Alaska cash
redis cluster let's get started
the best practice when using an Amazon
elasticash redis cluster is to turn on
multi-az this option allows for the
widest range of functionality and has
low data loss potential and performance
impact the cost to turn on multi-az can
range from low to high
when you create a new redis cluster with
cluster mode turned on this option is
also turned on by default
let's go through the steps to turn on
this option on your existing cluster
when it is not turned on by default
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the elastic cache
console
from the list in the upper right corner
choose the AWS region where the cluster
that you want to modify is located
in the navigation pane choose redis
cluster
in the list of clusters choose the name
of the cluster that you want to modify
then choose actions followed by modify
in the modify cluster window scroll to
the location subset
under multi-az choose the check box next
to enable
scroll down to select preview changes
underneath apply immediately remove the
check box if you want to wait for the
next maintenance window to apply these
changes
then select modify to accept the changes
the next option for disaster recovery
and fault Tolerance on your Amazon
elastic cache redis cluster is to turn
on automated backups this option has
high data loss potential medium to high
performance impact and low to medium
cost
here are the steps to turn on daily
automated backups for an existing Amazon
elastic cache redis cluster after
logging into the AWS Management console
navigate to the elasticash console
from the list in the upper right corner
choose the AWS region where the cluster
that you want to modify is located
in the navigation pane choose redis
cluster
in the list of clusters choose the name
of the cluster that you want to modify
then choose actions followed by modify
in the modify cluster window scroll to
the backup subset
place a check in the box next to enable
automatic backups
select the number of days for these
automatic backups to be retained before
they're deleted the maximum setting is
35 days
then specify the start time for when you
want the backups to run you can also
leave this setting at default to allow
AWS to decide when to run the backup
scroll down to select preview changes
underneath apply immediately remove the
check box if you want to wait for the
next maintenance window to apply these
changes
then select modify to accept the changes
so now you know how to implement
Disaster Recovery or fault tolerance for
your Amazon elastic cache redis cluster
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
